title: Registered Vet Nurse role at Merseyside Charity Hospital
description:
We work closely with the PDSA and their Hospital in Merseyside is looking for a dedicated RVN to join their team on a full-time basis.

• Salary – £26,655 - £31,027 per annum
• Hours – 37.5 hours per week
• Contract – Full Time, Permanent
• Flexible working options available!

This PDSA provides vital veterinary care to pets whose owners would otherwise be unable to afford treatment. With a focus on impact over targets, it delivers high-quality care in a supportive and pragmatic environment.

This position offers a diverse and engaging workload, including consultations, in-patient care, medication dispensing, and theatre support, including Schedule 3 procedures. The successful candidate will be confident in communication, collaborative, and passionate about sharing skills and promoting the organisation's mission.

The hospital in Merseyside is modern and well-equipped, typically featuring separate dog and cat kennels, radiography, ultrasound, endoscopy, piped gases, and extensive orthopaedic equipment. The team includes a wide range of clinical interests, encouraging knowledge sharing and collaboration. A flexible approach to rotas is in place, with enhanced pay and compensatory time off for weekend shifts.

Candidates must be qualified RVNs with a proactive and adaptable approach. The role requires strong communication skills, a team-focused mindset, and a drive to support both patient care and the charity’s broader mission.

Further benefits of this role include:
• Remote and flexible working options
• CPD Allowance: one week and £500 per year
• Full RCVS fees covered
• Access to internal CPD programmes and discounts for major veterinary events
• 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays), with buy/sell options for up to 5 days
• One additional Wellbeing Day per year
• Pension schemes starting at 5% contributions, rising to 10%
• Life Assurance (4x annual salary)
• 24/7 Employee Assistance Programme and Online Wellbeing Centre
• Discounts on retail, holidays, and more!

This is a unique opportunity for a Registered Veterinary Nurse to make a meaningful impact while enjoying strong support and professional development in Merseyside.

If you are interested, please contact Emillie ASAP on: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

title: Full-time Vet Surgeon Vacancy in PDSA Hospital Cardiff
description:
Emillies client, the PDSA in Cardiff, is seeking confident Vet Surgeons to join their team full-time at their welcoming Pet Hospital!

• Salary £43,950 - £58,312 per annum (including allowances)
• Full-time, 37.5 hours per week
• Flexible working options available regarding hours and shifts
• Hours typically 8am-4.30pm or 9am-5.30pm (but shifts could be any variation between 8am-8pm)

The ideal candidate will be a qualified Vet who enjoys working as part of a large and close-knit team. You must have strong people skills, be confident in communicating with a wide range of clients and, of course, have a good sense of humour. They also believe in developing talent across the practice so being willing to share your skills and lead by example is essential.

Join a company with over 100 years’ experience providing expert care for sick and injured pets! Focusing on measuring impact rather than hitting targets. To achieve this balance effectively, support is key and there is always the opportunity to share complex cases and discuss treatment plans and outcomes with all team members, including both highly experience surgeons and those new to the profession.

Cardiff has something for everyone! Feel your heart race at the international white water centre, discover 2000 years of history within its castle, shop until you drop in a centre full of top brands and thriving independent shops, or perhaps join in its buzzing music, arts, and foodie scene, or maybe soak up the atmosphere and the Welsh passion for rugby at its Principality stadium, or even head-out of the city to explore 185 miles of National Parks, fairy-tale castles, snow-capped peaks and coastal paths.

The hospital is on the peripheral of the city and inside you’ll find a hive of veterinary activity along with a warm Welsh welcome. In addition to its friendly environment, the hospital also benefits from having six consulting rooms; two dedicated theatres; a separate dental room; large prep area; imaging suite with digital radiography, ultrasound and endoscopy; piped gases; extensive orthopaedic equipment and a supportive team of experienced Veterinary Surgeons, 2 x Veterinary team leaders, Registered Veterinary Nurses and Veterinary Care Assistants and Head Nurse.

Due to a growing demand for services, they are looking to expand their veterinary team and wanting to fill several veterinary roles. More importantly, they value the importance of good work-life balance, offering a great deal of flexibility around roles including:

• Full-time or Part-time working opportunities
• Welcoming of overseas applicants, as long as you are RCVS registered, happy to explore sponsorship opportunities.

You’ll be working in a fast-paced environment where you will come across challenges. The hospital covers its own OOHs (but they ensure you have sufficient down-time post OOH so that work-life balance remains positive). Their working hours are 8am-8pm but most typically shifts will be either 8am-4:30pm or 9am-5:30pm (but shifts could be any variation between 8am-8pm). However, they can be super flexible around working hours, days, patterns – when asked they will look to accommodate your needs alongside their own.

They understand the importance of growth and development, and how it can mean different things to different people. You will always be supported on this journey, whether it be developing clinical skills or working towards management goals. If you are after more surgical experience, they offer a share of BOH opportunity across the entire vet team but this is further supported by two vet team leaders as well as a seasoned and dedicated vet team, many whom have years of experience to learn from.

You will benefit from:

• 25 days holiday per year with an additional day off to focus on well-bring (pro rata)
• A monthly travel allowance
• Paid Bank Holidays
• Contributory Pension Scheme
• Private Medical Insurance after 12 months
• CPD Allowance of one week and £1000 per year
• Wide range of staff discounts
• Relocation/Sponsorship support considered
• Enhance maternity pay
• Employee Assistance Program
• Life assurance – 4 x annual salary
• RCVS fees paid in full
• Free parking

If you are interested in this fantastic role, please contact Emillie now: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

title: Exciting Vet Surgeon Vacancy near Heathrow Airport
description:
Laceys client in West London is looking for a confident and ambitious Vet to join their team at their independently owned two-site small animal practice near Heathrow.

• Salary between £55,000 and £70,000.
• 4-day week (9am-7pm)
• 1:3 Saturday mornings only (9am-12pm)
• No OOHs, on call or Bank Holidays!
• Excellent transport links to central London
• Minutes from Heathrow – ideal for weekend getaways or international travel

Join a friendly and caring team who provide exceptional service to their clients and individually tailored compassionate care to the animals they see!

Their Head of Clinic and Principal Vet, joined them in 2019, bringing a wealth of experience and has played a key role in the transformation of the practice. He was appointed Director in 2022 and enjoys all aspects of small animal medicine, with a key interest in pet behaviour and exotic pets. Although he now spends most of his time behind the scenes working on the business side of the practice, he is always happy to support his team and is committed to creating a positive, progressive environment where both pets and people thrive.

They are looking to expand their Vet team with the addition of an experienced GP Vet. This role is perfect for a Vet Surgeon who is confident in working sole charge and eager to take the next step in their career. You will be given the clinical freedom to work up your cases the way you see fit, with full support to pursue your interests, whether that means developing a specific area of expertise or growing the caseload in your chosen field, they will support you with every step – including the opportunity to introduce new services that reflect your passions and enhance the care they can provide. More importantly, you’ll become an integral part of a supportive, independent practice that is growing with purpose – where your voice is heard and your ideas are valued, allowing you to make a real difference.

This role provides more than just day-to-day clinical work. If you want to play a strategic role in shaping the direction of a practice – then this opportunity will give you exactly that. This is a fantastic platform for anyone looking to hone their leadership skills, contribute to strategic decisions, and work closely with the director to drive the practice forward.

Both standalone clinics offer excellent facilities, featuring a dedicated prep area, theatre, diagnostic suite, and all the usual equipment, including digital X-ray, ultrasound, and a full Idexx in-house lab. Both clinics will be renovated later this year, with the additional interest of investing in a dental X-ray soon.

They understand the importance of work-life balance, so their vets work a 4-day week (9-7) with just 1:3 Saturday mornings only (9-12). Their out-of-hours is outsourced, meaning there are no OOH or on-call duties, and your evenings, Sundays, and bank holidays are free, giving you sufficient time to recharge.

Your days will include a mix of consultations and procedures. With morning consults finishing at 11.30 am and evening consults starting at 4 pm, meaning there is plenty of time in between to handle the manageable procedures list, work up your cases, catch up on admin and make phone calls. The last consult slot is at 6.30 pm, so you’ll be out the door at 7 pm.

Further benefits include:
• 33 days holiday
• CPD is encouraged, with certificates supported
• Professional fees paid for RCVS and VDS
• Easily accessible clinics with fantastic transport links
• Short trip to central London via the Elizabeth Line or National Rail
• Minutes from Heathrow

If you are interested in this role, please contact Lacey ASAP: 01395 200189 / Lacey.Dorliac@SynergyVets.com

title: Veterinary Surgeon with a Surgical Bias wanted at Independent Practice in Surrey
description:
Laceys client in Surrey is looking for a Vet Surgeon with a surgical bias to work in their independent practice. Would you like the time to develop your surgical skills with the support of a friendly team?

• Starting salary of £50,000 with a generous CPD allowance
• 4-day week including 3 dedicated operating days
• 1 in 4 Saturdays (9:00am – 12:00pm)
• No Sundays, bank holidays, or out-of-hours!
• 20-minute consults with protected admin and lunch breaks

The practice is proudly independent with a supportive, close-knit team who have strong collaborative ethos. All of the equipment has recently been updated including a DR X-ray, tonopen, syringe driver, Phovia, and more! You will be supported by a highly skilled nursing team during consults and throughout all patient care. The team has daily catchups to contribute to their continuous learning culture. Working collaboratively towards a stress-free, patient centered care approach.

The ideal candidate will be someone with a surgical bias who enjoys mentoring others. You must have strong communication skills and be willing to contribute towards the practice’s relationship-led approach to client care. If you are someone confident in your clinical ability and happy to contribute towards a growing, evolving team, this might be the role for you.

Further benefits include:
• 5 weeks annual leave (plus additional holiday after 2 years)
• Opportunities to grow into a leadership role
• Sick pay
• Health cash plan (physio, dental, optometry, etc.)
• Cycle to work scheme
• Regular social events and a supportive team environment

If you are interested in this role, please contact Lacey ASAP: 01395 200189 / Lacey.Dorliac@SynergyVets.com

title: Exciting Lead Vet Surgeon role in Essex
description:
Dans client in Essex is looking for a dedicated Vet Surgeon, who is ready to take the next step in their career and join their talented and supportive team as their Lead Vet!

• Lead Veterinary Surgeon
• Salary up to £70,000 (DOE)
• Full-time, 40 hours per week (across 4 days)
• 1 in 4 Saturdays
• No OOHs
• Will consider part-time/flexible hours

This is a fantastic opportunity for a Vet to step into a leadership position within a progressive, well-equipped practice. You will collaborate with the clinical nursing manager to shape the clinical direction of the team, while delivering a high standard of quality care to patients.

As a lead Vet you will be responsible for guiding and supporting the clinical team to deliver outstanding pet care, play a key-role in decision making and mentoring and build the practice culture with strong collaboration and purpose. All with the support of the highly experienced practice director.

Their current team consist of 4 experienced vets and dedicated nursing/support staff, all who are extremely supportive of each other. The practice boasts state-of-the-art facilities including a large imaging suite, laparoscopy, X-ray, duel operating theatres, 5 consult rooms, separate cattery and kennels, and a dedicated “goodbye” room. They also have close relationships with the nearby specialist hospitals (just 5 minutes down the road).

The ideal person for this role will be confident and have strong routine surgical skills. It would be favourable if you have previous experience as a Senior or Lead Vet, however this isn’t a requirement. If you are looking to step up, this might be the perfect role for you! As long as you enjoy developing others, lead by example and have an understanding of team management.

Further benefits to expect with this role include:
• 5 weeks holiday + birthday leave + bank holidays
• Funded external CPD (including certificates on approval)
• Paid RCVS and VDS fees
• Enhanced equal family leave and sickness pay
• CPD programmes and career progression support
• Staff discount schemes
• Cycle-to-work scheme, e-car salary sacrifice, and more
• Wellbeing support: EAP, flu jab, eyecare vouchers

If you are interested, please contact Dan now: 01395 200189 / Daniel.Howe@SynergyVets.com

title: Registered Veterinary Nurse Role in Southampton
description:
A dedicated and compassionate Registered Veterinary Nurse is sought to join a growing nursing team committed to delivering exceptional clinical care and customer service.

• Registered Veterinary Nurse (RVN)
• £26,000–£30,000 DOE
• 39 hours per week
• 4 nine-hour days per week
• 1:4 weekends required
• Duty nights on a rotating basis

This role supports the Head Nurse in enhancing the efficiency, effectiveness, governance, and continuous improvement of clinical activities within the surgery.

The ideal candidate will be a collaborative team player with strong communication skills and a passion for working on a varied caseload. A commitment to professional development is essential, as the team values continuous learning and offers a wealth of opportunities for further training and growth.

The successful candidate will work in a purpose-built, modern facility equipped with state-of-the-art technology. The team consists of passionate professionals with a wide range of special interests, many of whom are currently pursuing certificates to broaden their clinical expertise and enhance the services offered.

This role is part of the UK’s largest independent, family-owned veterinary group. With a nationwide presence, the group provides exceptional care in local communities, helping pets live long, healthy, and happy lives. The working environment is designed to support top-tier clinical care, foster staff satisfaction, promote calmness in patients, and instil confidence in clients.
Ongoing investment in team development ensures there’s never been a better time to join this forward-thinking and supportive organization.

Further Benefits Include:
• Profit share bonus scheme
• Long service recognition
• Income protection
• Enhanced maternity pay
• Compassionate leave
• Staff discounts
• Opportunities for overseas charity work
• Boost retail discounts and rewards
• CPD allowance
• Health and wellbeing support via Help at Hand

If this sounds like the job for you, please contact Lacey now on: 01395 200189 / Lacey.Dorliac@SynergyVets.com

title: Night Registered Veterinary Nurse Vacancies – West Midlands
description:
A well-established, privately owned veterinary practice in the West Midlands is currently seeking two dedicated Registered Veterinary Nurses (RVNs) to join their out-of-hours team. This is a fantastic opportunity for RVNs looking for a structured night shift pattern and a supportive, long-term role within a friendly and diverse team.

Key Details:
• Position: 2 x Night RVNs
• Shift Pattern: 7 nights on / 7 nights off
• Hours: 8pm – 8am
• Salary: £35,000 (negotiable depending on experience)

What’s on Offer:
• Supportive and inclusive working environment
• Competitive salary
• CPD encouraged and funded
• Staff discounts
• Opportunities for career development in a private practice setting

This role is ideal for RVNs who enjoy working independently during out-of-hours periods while being part of a wider collaborative team.

If you are interested, please contact Emillie now for further details: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@Synergyvets.com

title: Farm Vet Vacancy at progressive practice in Shropshire
description:
Emillies client in Shropshire is looking for someone to bring new ideas into the fold, sharing and developing their veterinary experience within the team to strengthen what the practice has to offer. If you’re a farm vet looking for the next step in your career, this might be the role for you!

• Full-time Farm Vet role
• 1 in 10 OOH rota, with options to buy and sell OOH work to increase flexibility
• 2 years’ experience preferred
• Ideally, you’ll have experience in handling OOHs cases and a solid base of surgical skills.
• Chance to work amongst 30 experienced vets, sharing experience!

This role is great from someone looking to grow, learning from an experienced team while developing their own interests through training and hands on experience!
They value vets who like to challenge the status quo and don’t believe in standing still: not everything they attempt will work, but they believe in experimenting and learning from times of failure. The practice will support projects you think will positively impact the team and clients, in hope you can share unique perspectives gained in previous roles.

Creating great client relationships is imperative. You must want to build on these with the farmers during routine dairy herd health work. A good understanding of cattle reproduction and ultrasound is needed to help conversation flow, as they would like you to get involved immediately. Opportunities to work with the wider client-base can be developed through discussion and benchmarking groups as well as health planning.

They believe that sharing is caring – the farmers benefit from having two vets involved on their farm, and communication between vets (as well as with farmers) is an essential skill. You’ll be working with 30-strong team members, including 12 clinical vets, with strong team ethos and a collaborative approach.

Hard work shouldn’t be something to be afraid of, they’re seeking someone who wants to get stuck in from the start, joining their 1 in 10 rota and covering the day-to-day emergencies of a busy dairy-focused practice. You should be confident in handling cases out-of-hours and have a solid base of surgical skills (this is expected), typical of those with at least 2 years’ experience of farm vetting under their belt. The practice is also involved in vet school teaching, farmer training, product and germplasm export and sheep / cattle AI & embryo transfer – and are always keen to support those looking to develop in these areas.

If this sounds like a role that would suit you, please still get in touch. More importantly, they are looking for someone who is enthusiastic, enjoys working as a team and is a problem solver. Ideally, they are seeking a full-time vet to join our team, but for the right person they will be flexible with days / hours.

Founded in 1999, as the first farm animal only vet practice in the UK, growing to a multi-site business with more than 30 vets working in their practices. They continue to deliver expertise to clients across the country. They have a very close team with a social culture and strong core values; positivity, proactivity, innovation and integrity, empathy, efficiency, and effectiveness. The team consists of experienced farm clinicians, Vet techs, TB Vets, approved TB testers, embryo transfer specialists and a brilliant support team who keep everything ticking.

You can expect benefits of:
• Attractive remuneration package
• 1 in 10 OOH rota, with options to buy and sell OOH work to increase flexibility
• 25 days holiday plus bank holidays with additional days in lieu for weekends on call
• Vehicle provided, or allowance
• Minimal TB testing, due to having an experienced TB team
• Flexible CPD allowance
• Health Shield cash plan
• Private medical insurance (after a year’s service)
• One volunteering day per year

If you like the sound of this role, please send your CV to Emillie or call on: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

title: Full-time Orthopaedic Vet Surgeon role in South Wales
description:
Emillies client in South Wales is looking for an orthopaedic Vet to join them full-time at their supportive practice near the Brecon Beacons!

• Salary depending on experience
• Full-time, 4-day week (part-time considered)
• Open to flexible working patterns, as it is more important for us to find the right candidate who will fit in with the team.
• Saturday rota of 1:5 and inpatient on-call rota 1:6 (Mon-Fri only, no nights on call on Sat/Sun/BH's)
• 8.45am start. Last appointment 6.15pm
• 15-minute appointments

This is a great role for an experienced Vet Surgeon, who is passionate about orthopaedics, looking for an exciting new opportunity! Or perhaps a skilled Surgeon looking to develop your orthopaedic skill set?

Their current orthopaedic surgeon is unfortunately leaving, after 14 years, for their next adventure. Leaving some big shoes to fill!
The rest of the team are not very keen on using power tools during surgery…therefore, they are looking for a replacement vet to take up that mantle.

The ideal candidate would already have experience performing TPLO/CCWO/TTA and fracture fixation, as well as having soft tissue surgical and general practice skills. However, they would also be happy to support teaching of a candidate with a solid foundation in surgical techniques who wishes to learn new orthopaedic procedures, as the practice has a visiting RCVS advanced practitioner in surgery, endoscopy and endosurgery available to assist/support if needed. Some previous experience or previous CPD in these procedures would be preferred, but this could be an amazing opportunity for a candidate wishing to take that next step in their career.

The practice outsources their OOHs but currently keeps their own in-patients, a service which they are proud of. Offering their patients greater continuity of care and reduces stress of moving them to OOHs providers.
Patients are cared for overnight by the night nursing team, as well as having a vet on call to assist with any issues. Their current on-call rota is full, but they would appreciate someone who is able to offer back up support to the junior vets on a 1:6 basis.
In addition to leading the orthopaedic service, you will be a capable GP Vet who still enjoys less fancy procedures and doesn’t mind giving a vaccine or two. You will be working across their 4 RCVS accredited branches in South Wales, all equipped with ultrasound, digital X-ray, in house blood machines etc. Their branches consist of a mixture of consults and surgeries/procedures, whereas the main branch is where they keep hospitalised patients.

Together, they like to prioritise team well-being by seeing that everyone finishes on time, ensuring full lunch breaks, you have time for a cuppa and toilet breaks when needed (all non-negotiable).
They have administration time built into vet diaries, so you aren’t expected to update owners or check up on labs in lunch breaks or after you have finished for the day.
Labelled “trail blazers” for the new BVA Good Workplace Accreditation scheme. This scheme focuses on ensuring workplaces support colleagues across a wide range of areas. An exciting scheme to be taking part in, they are committed to working with the BVA to work towards accreditation – not just about an award but truly learning from the process to ensure that they provide the best possible work environment.

They are appreciative of supporting a good work-life balance as well as the importance of job satisfaction – and really strive to ensure all the team feel fulfilled in their career, as well as being able to enjoy and cherish their free time out of work. They are very supportive of working parents and appreciate the difficulties of trying to be both a vet and parent, they will always work hard to find solutions at work to help being the best of both.
At this practice you will have great opportunity for development, and certificates will be fully supported, along with all other career aspirations. They want you to grow and develop and grow as part of their team. They also believe in having lots of fun at work, winter/summer parties, cake, team competitions, and having fun outside of work!

Located in a beautiful part of the world, near the Brecon Beacons National Park, with great transport links and easy access to Bristol and Cardiff in 45 minutes and 2.5 hours to London. The main branch sits in a friendly market town offering many activities such as rowing, fell running, knitting, cooking and enjoying the many “foodie” opportunities in the area. Many of which the team enjoys in their time off.
They have previously supported colleagues at all points in their careers, from newly graduated vets to those returning after a career break, to those working towards a certificate and those wanting to pursue leadership/management roles.

Further benefits to expect include:
• 28 days holiday including bank hols (based on 4 days/week)
• £1750 CPD allowance per annum plus 5 days
• Health Shield - wide ranging contributions for health and wellbeing treatments - from dentistry to sports massage
• RCVS Membership paid and two other membership subscriptions
• VDS cover
• Enhanced paternity, maternity, adoption, shared parental leave and surrogacy pay
• Discounted veterinary fees
• One day paid for volunteering (your choice of where)
• Offers, discounts and cashback on shopping, travel, entertainment and much more
• Cycle to Work scheme
• Company sick pay
• Visa sponsorship
• Annual pay reviews
• Focus on employee wellbeing
• Career progression opportunities
• Colleague engagement survey
• CPD/training support

If you are interested in this role, please contact Emillie now: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

title: Exciting Fixed-term RVN Vacancy in Warwickshire practice
description:
Emillies client, a small animal practice in Warwickshire, is seeking a friendly and committed Registered Veterinary Nurse to join their fabulous team!

• Salary up to £30,000 (DOE)
• 6-month maternity cover
• 30 hours per week
• 1 in 5 Saturday rota
• No OOHs or sole charge!

The practice is RCVS accredited, who have also achieved cat and dog friendly status. Their opening hours are 8am-6:30pm Monday to Friday and 8:30am-12:30pm on Saturdays. There is no OOHS or sole charge required with this role, as they strive for excellent work-life balance and value the well-being of their team. They hold regular social events throughout the year and have fruit Tuesdays, along with home baked cakes mixed in between!

Their current team consists of 5 vets, 4 RVNs, 1 SVN and 4 very helpful receptionists. One of their vets holds a general small animal certificate and another is working towards a surgical certificate. They offer laparoscopic procedures in house, as well as having endoscopes, digital x-ray and dental x-ray. One RVN is currently undertaking a certificate in anaesthesia, another has a certificate in exotics whilst others are working towards behaviour and feline awards.

They need an RVN to cover 6 months maternity leave, circa 30 hours per week, but will consider other options for the right candidate. Saturdays will be on a 1:5 rota.
They like to actively encourage nurses to use and develop their skills and progress in other areas such as clinical coaching, certificates, and schedule 3 procedures. Your working week will be split for a day in surgery, a day on consultations and inpatient/recoveries, however they are open to looking at this if you have a particular passion in one area.

Their range of benefits includes:
• 6 weeks paid holiday including bank holidays (pro-rata)
• £600.00 CPD and 3 days allowance per annum (pro-rata)
• Health Shield – wide ranging contributions for health and wellbeing treatments – from dentistry to sports massage
• RCVS Membership paid
• One other membership subscription
• VDS cover
• Enhanced paternity, maternity, adoption, shared parental leave and surrogacy pay, discounted veterinary fees
• Offers, discounts and cashback on shopping, travel, entertainment and much more
• Cycle to work scheme
• CPD/training support
• Company sick pay: 2 weeks full pay, 4 weeks half pay
• Colleague engagement survey
• Focus on employee wellbeing
• Career progression opportunities

If you are interested, please contact Emillie ASAP: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

title: Full-time RVN role in friendly Cheshire Practice
description:
Are you an enthusiastic and compassionate RVN eager to make a difference? Emillies client in Cheshire has an exciting vacancy with the chance to be part of a supportive team!

• Competitive salary of £27,500 - £32,000 (DOE) pro rata.
• Full-time, 40 hours per week.
• 1 in 3 Saturdays (with time off in lieu)
• Mix of early (8:30am-5pm) and late (10:30am-7pm) shifts.
• Mix of consults and theatre work

The practice itself is at a pivotal point of growth, enhancing their nurse clinics and embracing innovative ways to engage with pets and clients alike. They are looking to welcome experienced professionals or newly qualified RVNs. They would like someone with a passion for patient care, who is eager to contribute to daily operations and perhaps explore pathways towards practice partnership.

Across the week you will be responsible for a mix of consults and theatre, working closely with all the clinical team. Consults run throughout the day and consist of a mix of post op checks, development clinics, socialisation/desensitisation clinics and 2nd/3rd vaccines. The practice sees a variety of work from routine neutering and dentistry to orthopaedics and soft tissue surgery. If you would like to have a voice and your thoughts and ideas heard, the team runs clinical governance meetings most Friday, taking your ideas on board!

You can expect benefits of:
• A friendly, supportive environment
• A diverse caseload
• A generous CPD allowance to support growth
• Company pension contribution
• Paid memberships, including RCVS, BVNA, and more.
• Exclusive discounts and rewards!

If you are interested in this role, please contact Emillie now: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

title: Experienced Vet role at Hampshire Practice
description:
Lacey’s client in Hampshire is looking for an experienced vet to join their supportive, friendly team! Would you like to be part of a practice where you can learn knew skills and achieve your career goals? How about with the support of a multi-certificate holder behind you?

• Salary up to £60,000 (DOE)
• Ideally full-time (flexibility for shorter hours considered)
• Shared Saturday rota, open 9am-12pm.
• No out-of-hours
• Occasional sole charge
• Interest in ultrasonography or medicine desired, but not essential.
• Work no later than 7pm!

This small animal practice in Hampshire is growing fast, therefore they are looking for an additional Vet Surgeon to join their friendly team. The practice owner is an Advanced Practitioner in small animal surgery and opened the practice in June 2018. Her multiple certificates include a certificate in emergency medicine and surgery as well as in soft/tissue orthopaedic surgery certAVP(gSAS), putting the practice in a unique position to offer a varied case load and learning experience. In addition, she also has a Zoology degree, therefore they include exotics in their cases.

In addition to their impressive practice owner, you will be joining an exceptional team including another full time Veterinary Surgeon, 3 RVNs, 1 Student Nurse and 3 receptionists with their nurse team having a combined experience of 50 years!

Days are structured with consultations between 9am-12pm with ops 11am-2pm, lunch and then consultations again from 3pm with the last consultation at 6pm so that everyone can leave on time when the practice closes at 7pm.
Ideally this is a full-time role to support the growth of the practice, with flexibility for shorter hours considered if required. In addition, there is a shared Saturday rota when we open between 9am and midday, for consultations and emergencies only. There is no OOH.

They are looking for a colleague with solid GP experience, confident in occasional sole charge, a team player with great communication skills and someone capable of providing the highest level of veterinary care. Someone with an interest in ultrasonography or medicine would be preferred, but this is not essential, and they do have orthopaedic equipment on site, however, are open to investing in further equipment depending on your skill sets or interests.

The practice itself is a bright and airy standalone practice which as well as the 3 consult rooms and theatre, also includes a designated office and staff room upstairs with kitchen and seating area. In addition it is excellently located, with easy access to the picturesque New Forest National Park, making it a desirable place for anyone wishing to explore both coast and countryside.

Further benefits include:
• 4 weeks holiday + 8 bank holidays’ (FTE)
• Life assurance 4 x annual salary
• Contributory pension scheme
• Paid memberships (RCVS, BVA, VDS)

title: Lancashire Small Animal Vet Surgeon role – 12 months FTC
description:
Emillies client in Lancashire is seeking a SA Vet Surgeon to join their supportive and friendly team on a 12-month fixed term contract (FTC)!

• Salary between £40,000 and £60,000 (DOE).
• Full-time, 12-month FTC.
• Open to discussing flexible working options.
• Work with certificate holding Vets including medicine, dentistry and ECC.

The practice was established in 1911, and offers high quality, first opinion veterinary care to small animals in a stunning area of Lancashire. They have a large team with varied experience, including certificate holders in medicine, dentistry and ECC. In addition, several of their nursing team also hold certificates in ECC, anaesthesia, feline nursing, feline medicine, dentistry and physiotherapy. The practice also provide 24-hour care for clients an inpatients with 3 dedicated night RVNs (2 with ECC certificates) who take the phones overnight for the on-call vets.

The branch is equipped with digital x-ray, ultrasound machine, flexible & rigid endoscopy, two surgical theatres with multiparameter monitors and a dental suite with dental x-ray machine. They also have an extensive in-house laboratory, 4 consulting rooms and a designated bereavement room, as well as separate canine and feline inpatient wards. This allows them to treat their varied and high caseload, making room for progression in many areas of veterinary practice.

CPD and further education is actively encouraged, with a generous £1700 CPD budget and 5 paid days of per annum (pro rata). With the addition of certificates being encourage and funded. RCVS memberships and VDS cover will be provided, plus two other subscriptions/memberships.

They work closely with peripatetic specialists in ultrasonography and cardiology, enabling them to work up the majority of cases in-house. Along with working closely with the University of Central Lancashire as a training practice, as they are a registered nurse training facility. Investing in an improved well-being at work, by being a supportive workplace with several GDP mentors, mental health first aiders and well-being champions who meet regularly to arrange team events.

As a practice, they enjoy having frequent social events. Over the last few years, they have taken part in the annual charity Pub Walk, covering 13 miles and visiting a few pubs for refreshments on the way! Many of the team enjoy taking part in activities, often raising money for various charities.

Out of hours and On-Call Vets
• Full-time vets involved in the out-of-hours service do work a variation of 3, 4 and 5-day weeks throughout the 8-week rolling rota. If you are a full-time vet doing on-call, you will only have two 5-day weeks in every 8 weeks. However, many choose to have extra days off. They are very open to suggestions and happy to discuss what hours may suit you.
• Their clients really appreciate the in-house out-of-hours service. However, they understand how this can impact on vets and do ensure on-call is kept to a minimum, and vets have the following 24 hours off after being on call.
• To further improve overnight care and provide major support to vets, they have a dedicated team of RVN’s who work through the night. This makes being on call a lot less arduous for the on-call vet and greatly improves inpatient care.
• Providing in-house OOH care not only gives clients a better service but also increases case exposure. Thus, allowing you to build experience and confidence in dealing with emergency and critical care patients.

Weekend OOH rota is 1.5 in 8, with generous time off in lieu given:
• On-call Friday / Work Saturday morning only / Sunday on call (Monday & Tuesday off in lieu)
• On-call Saturday (With a Friday off in lieu), followed by 6 weekends off

In addition, you would be on-call approximately 1 night every other week with the following day off. The rota is on a continuous 8-week cycle, allowing you to plan your life ahead. They have an OOH telephone answering service, so you will not be taking calls directly.

You can expect to receive the benefits of:
• 6.6 weeks holiday a year, including Bank Holidays (Pro Rata), with a holiday buy-back scheme, for those who love to travel
• You will have access to an Employee Assistance Programme
• You are also allowed to take 1 paid day volunteering leave, pro rata
• They offer a corporate gym membership for £22.50/month and are part of the Cycle to Work scheme
• Enhanced maternity, paternity, adoption, shared parental leave and surrogacy pay
• Private medical insurance available through group payroll deduction
• Team pets are like family, well-behaved pets should be able to come to work with you

If you are interested in this role, please contact Emillie now on: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

description:
A friendly, forward-thinking veterinary team in Kent is growing – and they’re looking for a dedicated and compassionate Veterinary Surgeon to join them. This is more than just a job. It’s an opportunity to be part of a team where kindness, respect, and genuinely putting pets and their people first are at the heart of everything they do.

Well-established in the local community for over eight years, this small animal practice has built a loyal and growing client base. Known for delivering high standards of care in a warm, welcoming environment, clients often say the team feels more like family than a clinic.
Led by a vet and a veterinary nurse, the leadership team understands the real-life challenges of clinical work. Their approach is rooted in compassion, honesty, and a deep respect for their people – values reflected in the supportive and collaborative culture they’ve created.

The practice is a proud member of the Practice Standards Scheme, holds a Good Client Service Award, and is committed to creating an inclusive, supportive environment for both clients and colleagues.
The current team includes three experienced vets, five fantastic RVNs, a VCA, and four friendly receptionists – all dedicated to teamwork, continuous learning, and supporting one another (often over coffee and cake!).

• Kind, enthusiastic, and an excellent communicator

• Calm and adaptable, even in a busy environment

Flexibility is genuinely valued, and the team is happy to accommodate full-time or part-time rotas, including school hours. Plus, there are no out-of-hours requirements!

Further benefits include:

title: Experienced/Senior Vet Surgeon role at Friendly Gloucestershire Practice
description:
Looking for a fresh challenge or the next step in a veterinary career? Keen to work in the picturesque Cotswolds? This exciting opportunity is ideal for a committed veterinary surgeon ready to take on Senior Vet responsibilities or step into a Senior Vet role.

• Salary: Up to £70,000 depending on experience & hours
• Preferably full-time between the hours of 8.30am – 6.30pm, Monday to Friday
• 40hrs/week but open to discussion on working patterns for the right person (part-time considered)
• No weekends!
• No OOH work - local referral centre provides cover!
• Close EVERYDAY for a lunchbreak to ensure that everyone gets time to sit down and eat without being disturbed.

The position offers not only the chance to continue clinical work at a high standard but also the opportunity to influence the future direction of a progressive and supportive practice.

The successful candidate will join a forward-thinking team during a period of growth and development, where ideas and experience will be welcomed in driving continued improvement and innovation in clinical care.

The Ideal Candidate will be experienced in first-opinion veterinary care, confident with a broad caseload and able to support and mentor junior colleagues. Whilst being interested in contributing to clinical standards and decision-making processes. A particular passion for surgery is desirable but not required. They are open to supporting further training and development, including support for certification!

A respected, RCVS-accredited small animal practice with a longstanding reputation for providing compassionate, high-quality care across Gloucestershire, Wiltshire, and Oxfordshire. The main site is located in a charming market town surrounded by the stunning Cotswolds countryside, offering a calm, friendly working environment.

The practice is well-equipped with modern facilities, including digital x-ray, ultrasound, multiparameter anaesthetic monitoring, in-house lab equipment, and advanced dental tools. Many clients have been with the team for years, creating a trusted, community-focused atmosphere.

This is a workplace proud to have earned a 3* world-class rating for employee engagement from Best Companies.

The close-knit team includes two full-time equivalent vets, a practice manager who is also an RVN, three experienced RVNs, two SVNs, and a supportive administrative staff. Team culture is highly valued, with strong encouragement for personal and professional growth. Social activities include local pub quizzes, countryside dog walks, and regular team events.

Based on the edge of the Cotswolds, the area offers independent shops, cafés, pubs, and beautiful local walks. The nearby Cotswold Water Park provides access to various water sports. Excellent transport links connect to Oxford, Swindon, Cirencester, Bath, Bristol, and London – ideal for exploring during downtime.

Further Benefits Include (Pro Rata):
• 6.6 weeks of paid holiday including bank holidays
• £1,750 annual CPD allowance
• RCVS and two other professional memberships paid
• VDS cover
• Health Shield – wide-ranging health and wellness contributions (e.g., dentistry, massage)
• Enhanced parental and adoption leave
• Discounted veterinary care
• Access to shopping, travel, entertainment discounts.
• Cycle to Work scheme
• Training and CPD support
• Company sick pay
• Annual pay reviews
• Career development opportunities
• Regular colleague engagement surveys
• Focus on wellbeing

Additional Info:
Relocation assistance is available, including the option of accommodation in nearby town – terms to be discussed.

If this sounds like the job for you, please contact Emillie ASAP on: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

title: Exciting full-time Vet Surgeon Vacancy in West Midlands
description:
Emillies client in the West Midlands are seeking a compassionate Vet Surgeon to join their friendly and supportive practice!

• Salary up to £75,000 FTE (DOE)
• Full-time position (part-time considered)
• A minimum of 1:4 Saturdays (9am-12pm)
• No OOHs required!

Join a talented, supportive and longstanding team who have progressed within their own veterinary careers whilst at the practice. Both their Head Nurse and Senior RVN started at the practice as locums before becoming permanent, with the addition of their practice manager joining 9 years ago as a VCA.
The practice owner is a testament to the achievement she puts into her teams progression and development. Initially qualifying as a nursing assistant in 2006 before qualifying as a vet from the RVC in 2017.
Both the practice manager and owner are trained Mental Health First Aiders and along with the clinical team, are supported by a brilliant client care team as well as 5 RVNs, 1 of which is their Nursing Clinical Lead, 1 SVN, a Pharmacy Assistant and 1 VCA.
They are an approved training practice, with the owner/vet surgeon being a vet GDP advisor as well.

All team members have excellent relationships with the incredible client base, providing a varied and growing case load including small furries, exotics and dentistry.
They are a diverse team so depending on your own individual style, their consult times vary. However, breaks and an hour lunch break are always included in the day. It is important that you feel included, so regular catchups will be scheduled in after morning consults, with time to share your thoughts and ideas.
Full and Part time hours will be considered, for the right candidate, with a minimum of 1 in 4 Saturdays (9am-12pm). There is no OOHs required with this role, and they do their best to finish appointments half an hour before closing so that there is time to catchup and get away on time!

They do their best to be flexible and offer the facilities to support your ideas and areas of interests so due to the nature of the role and fantastic team you’ll be joining, they are welcoming of applicants at all levels of experience.
You must be RCVS registered, ideally with strong clinical skills and a surgical bias although they will consider new graduates as the practice is forever-growing.
Most of all, you must be a team player, a people person and committed to delivering outstanding care and customer service!

As well as an exceptional working environment, they offer further benefits including:
• Access to private health insurance
• A contributory pension scheme
• A generous CPD allowance (Plus funding towards certificates)
• 5.6 weeks initial holiday, rising to 6.6 weeks after 2 years’ service!
• A generous extra days’ leave for your birthday
• In-house career development opportunity
• Paid membership fees (RCVS, BVA, VDS)
• Funded sponsorship visas (Plus possible relocation allowance!)
• Access to wellbeing support and pastoral care
• Cycle to work scheme
• Plus, many more discounts, offers and contributions towards health and well-being.

If you are interested and would like more details, please contact Emillie ASAP: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

title: Senior Vet Surgeon role at Staffordshire PDSA hospital
description:
Emillies client, the PDSA in Staffordshire, is seeking a Senior Vet Surgeon to join their team full-time. Would you like to oversee a team making a meaningful difference?

• Salary £65,563 - £77,670 (including allowances) per annum.
• Full-time, 37.5 hours per week

In this role, you will be an important part of the hospital’s leadership, steering the team towards excellence in customer service, clinical care, and pet well-being. Your focus will be on fostering a supportive and motivated team dedicated to preventive services and treating sick and injured pets of eligible clients.

As Senior Vet Surgeon, you will overseas the Head Nurse and Veterinary Surgeons, playing a pivotal role in developing and mentoring the clinical team. You’ll be responsible for guiding the team’s daily workflow, ensuring all operations run smoothly and a high standard of both clinical practice and customer care are kept.

Your leadership will extend to overseeing clinical governance, income, and expenditure at the hospital. This includes managing treatment costs and optimising PDSA resources to provide cost-effective solutions without compromising on the quality of care delivered.

To be successful, you must be a proactive, people-focused leader who can drive clinical and operational excellence while nurturing a supportive, inclusive team culture. If you are passionate about veterinary care and possess the skills to inspire, develop, and lead, this might be the role for you!

Key Responsibilities:

• Provide leadership and motivation to the veterinary and nursing teams, fostering collaboration and a culture of ongoing development.
• Oversee daily operational activities to ensure efficient workflows and a positive, supportive workplace environment.
• Ensure high standards of clinical governance and promote the responsible and cost-effective use of resources.
• Manage hospital treatment budgets, focusing on financial sustainability and efficiency.
• Act as an ambassador for PDSA’s values, driving a strong commitment to outstanding pet care and animal welfare.

They’re seeking a dynamic, compassionate and adaptable Veterinary Surgeon with a strong foundation in both clinical excellence and team leadership. You’ll bring a proven ability to lead by example, inspire your colleagues, and nurture a positive, supportive, and growth-focused working environment.

With your natural leadership skills and empathetic communication style, you’ll build strong connections with both clients and team members. Your exceptional organisational abilities will help maintain smooth daily operations, enabling the team to navigate routine tasks and unexpected challenges while staying aligned with the hospital’s objectives.

Your proactive, solutions-focused mindset will allow you to make well-informed decisions, balancing clinical priorities with effective resource management. You’ll consistently deliver outcomes that enhance pet welfare and support team cohesion.

They’re looking for someone who combines empathy with professionalism—someone who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative setting and leads with integrity, optimism, and an unwavering dedication to delivering high-quality care. If you’re a forward-thinking Veterinary Surgeon ready to make a meaningful impact, please get in touch.

The PDSA are dedicated to fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion that truly reflects the communities they serve. They strive to create a workplace where everyone can thrive, make the most of their talents, and contribute fully—free from discrimination, harassment, or bias. Their commitment to fair and merit-based decision-making is central to everything they do. Also offering a variety of family-friendly and inclusive employment policies, along with flexible working options, to support and empower team members from all backgrounds.

They also offer a great range of benefits which include:

• 38 hours of CPD funding for ongoing development

title: Full-Time Veterinary Surgeon Vacancy in West Yorkshire
description:
A full-time, permanent Veterinary Surgeon position is available at a busy, family-run 24/7 hospital in West Yorkshire. This well-established hospital supports a network of 19 practices and serves as both an out-of-hours hub and a referral centre.

• Full-time Veterinary Surgeon
• Competitive salary, dependent on experience.
• 4-day working week (Monday–Friday), comprising a mix of consulting, surgery, and inpatient shifts
• 1 in 4 weekends (no sole charge; 10-hour shifts on Saturday and Sunday, focused on emergency and critical care, 30-minute consults, and inpatient management)
• £1,500 annual CPD allowance; certificate support and sponsorship encouraged
• Opportunity to work alongside certificate holders in Surgery, Medicine, and Dentistry
• Active internal CPD and clinical development program
• Join a supportive team of 70 colleagues, including 15 vets

This role would particularly suit an experienced vet with an interest in ophthalmology, as there is the potential to combine general duties with dedicated ophthalmology clinics and procedure days. With strong referral potential and a growing caseload in this area, there is significant scope to develop advanced services.

Due to the high clinical standards in both first opinion and hospital services (OOH and referrals), this role is not suitable for recent graduates or vets requiring significant in-house training. Applicants must have substantial experience working in UK veterinary practices and a proven clinical track record.

Advanced Procedures and Case Exposure:

The hospital regularly performs:
• Oesophageal tube placements
• Seldinger chest drain placements
• Silicone abdominal peritoneal drains
• Pig tail urinary catheters
• TFAST/AFAST
• Endoscopy
• Negative pressure wound therapy
• Urinary catheterisation

Common medical and surgical caseloads include:
• Caesareans
• Pyometra
• Exploratory laparotomies (enterotomy, enterectomy)
• Addison’s disease
• Diabetic ketoacidosis
• Severe pancreatitis

Facilities & Equipment include:

• In-house diagnostics: Procyte, Catalyst Dx, EPOC, Coags (APTT/PT), Angio/Felv/FIV/Parvo/Lepto, transfusion medicine, lipid testing
• Advanced imaging: Digital X-ray, CT, ultrasound with Doppler
• Scopes: Flexible video endoscope, bronchoscope, otoscope, rigid scope
• Surgery: Gen11 vessel sealing, Valleylab monopolar/bipolar, Ligaclips
• Laparoscopy
• Dental X-ray with CR7 developer
• Full multiparameter monitoring: ECG, capnography, SpO2, BP, temperature
• Doppler BP and ECG
• E20 sterilisation

This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced vet looking to work in a progressive, well-equipped hospital within a large and supportive team in West Yorkshire.

If you are interested, please contact Dan now on: 01395 200189 / Daniel.Howe@SynergyVets.com

title: 12 Month Fixed Term Contract for Vet in Lancashire
description:
My client is looking for a Small Animal Veterinary Surgeon to join their team on a 12-month fixed-term contract. This is a full-time role, though flexible working options can be discussed. The practice has been established for over a century and provides high-quality, first-opinion veterinary care across multiple branches in Lancashire.

The team is large, friendly, and highly experienced, with certificate holders in medicine, dentistry, and ECC. Many of the nursing team also hold advanced qualifications, including ECC, anaesthesia, feline nursing and medicine, dentistry, and physiotherapy. With qualified GDP mentors, mental health first aiders, and wellbeing champions on site, this is a supportive environment where colleagues look out for one another. Regular social activities and charity events are also an important part of the culture.

The main hospital site is well-equipped with digital x-ray, ultrasound, flexible and rigid endoscopy, two surgical theatres with multiparameter monitoring, a dental suite with dental x-ray, a bereavement room, and separate canine and feline wards. There is also an extensive in-house laboratory and four consulting rooms. The varied caseload provides an excellent opportunity to develop your skills further, and the practice regularly collaborates with visiting specialists in ultrasonography and cardiology to allow the majority of cases to be worked up in-house.

The practice provides its own 24-hour care, supported by three dedicated night RVNs (two with ECC certificates) who handle the phones overnight for the on-call vets, making out-of-hours work far more manageable while ensuring excellent inpatient care. Full-time vets covering OOH typically work a rotation of 3, 4, and 5-day weeks across an 8-week rolling rota, with only two 5-day weeks in every cycle. Out-of-hours shifts are supported by night nurses, and generous time off in lieu is given, with the following day off after being on call. The weekend OOH rota is 1.5 in 8 with additional rest days built in.



Benefits include
**Salary is between £40,000 and £60,000 depending on experience.
**CPD is actively encouraged with a £1,700 budget plus 5 days paid CPD leave annually (pro rata).
**Certificates are encouraged and can be fully funded.
**RCVS membership, VDS cover, and two additional professional memberships are also included.
**6.6 weeks holiday including bank holidays, with holiday buy-back scheme
**Private medical insurance (via group payroll deduction)
**Enhanced parental leave pay
**Employee Assistance Programme
**One paid volunteering day per year (pro rata)
**Corporate gym membership (£22.50/month) and Cycle to Work scheme
**The opportunity to bring well-behaved pets to work
**A collaborative, supportive workplace that values wellbeing and professional growth

This is a fantastic opportunity for a Veterinary Surgeon who wants to join a well-established team with excellent facilities, varied caseload, and strong support both in and out of hours.

The Hospital is set in a rural area with excellent transport links and offers a spacious, well-equipped environment. The team includes seven Veterinary Surgeons, 20 Registered Veterinary Nurses, and nine support staff. The management is highly committed to personal development, fostering a collaborative and supportive atmosphere.

Veterinary Nurses play a vital role in ensuring the smooth operation of this busy hospital, providing care for a diverse range of animal welfare cases, including companion animals and wildlife. The hospital operates around the clock and supports frontline animal welfare efforts by delivering essential veterinary services.

A typical day in this role may include providing direct medical and surgical care, supporting welfare cases, maintaining accurate clinical records, and dispensing medication in line with professional and internal guidelines. Nurses are also responsible for upholding high levels of clinical hygiene and biosecurity, monitoring anaesthesia, supporting perioperative care, and engaging in community outreach initiatives. Continued professional and personal development is a core part of the role and actively encouraged.

Applicants must be fully qualified Veterinary Nurses with current registration with the Royal College of Veterinary Surgeons (RCVS). They should bring prior experience from a relevant setting, such as a veterinary practice, wildlife rehabilitation centre, or animal welfare organisation. Successful candidates will demonstrate strong communication skills, sound clinical judgment, and the ability to make evidence-based decisions. They must be capable of working independently as well as collaboratively, possess excellent organisational and prioritisation skills, and show a proactive, problem-solving mindset.

All applicants must have the legal right to work in the UK, as visa sponsorship is not available. Some roles within the organisation may also require a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check.

title: Permanent Full-time Vet Surgeon role at 24/7 Vet Hospital in West Yorkshire
description:
A new, permanent full-time position for a Veterinary Surgeon is available at a busy, family-run 24/7 veterinary hospital in West Yorkshire. This opportunity is ideal for experienced veterinary professionals currently working in the UK and seeking a new role.

• Full-time Veterinary Surgeon
• Salary dependent on experience
• 1 in 4 weekends (no sole charge; 10-hour shifts on Saturday and Sunday, primarily ECC-focused with 30-minute sick pet consultations and inpatient care)
• 4 weekday shifts (Monday to Friday)
• In-house support from colleagues holding certificates in Surgery, Medicine, and Dentistry
• £1,500 annual CPD allowance; certificate sponsorship encouraged
• Active in-house CPD and clinical development program
• Large, supportive team of approximately 70 colleagues, including 15 vets

The hospital is looking for a Veterinary Surgeon to join their experienced clinical team. The role primarily focuses on consulting, making it ideal for those who enjoy client interaction and case work-up without a heavy surgical commitment. There is also an opportunity for candidates with a particular interest in ophthalmology to combine consulting duties with ophthalmology clinics and procedure days, with strong potential for developing these services further. Additionally, the hospital welcomes applications from vets with experience in inpatient care or hospital shifts, particularly those with an interest in imaging or intensive hospitalisation cases.

Due to the current surgical team being fully staffed, this role would not suit someone seeking a high surgical caseload. The position is aimed at experienced Veterinary Surgeons with substantial UK practice backgrounds. It is not suitable for new graduates, those requiring extensive in-house training, or individuals without prior UK practice experience.
As a hospital known for its high standards in both primary care and referral services, the team regularly performs advanced procedures such as oesophageal tube placements, seldinger chest drain placements, silicone abdominal peritoneal drains, pig tail urinary catheters, TFAST/AFAST, endoscopy, negative pressure would therapy and urinary catherisation. They also manage complex medical and surgical cases, including caesarean sections, pyometra surgeries, exploratory laparotomies, Addisonian crises, diabetic ketoacidosis, and severe pancreatitis.

The hospital is exceptionally well-equipped with a wide range of advanced diagnostic and treatment tools. These include:

• Procyte haematology
• Catalyst Dx
• EPOC
• Coags (APTT/PT)
• Angio/Felv/FIV/Gardia/Parvo/Lepto
• Transfusion Medicine
• Lipids
• Digital Xray, advanced ultrasound with doppler
• CT
• Flexible video gastroscope, bronchoscope
• Video Otoscope and Rigid scope
• Laparoscopy
• Dental Xray with CR7 Developer
• Multiparameter monitors inc ECG/Cap/Temp/Sp02/BP
• Doppler BP
• ECG
• Gen11 vessel sealing
• Valleylab monopolar/bipolar, Ligaclips
• E20 sterilisation

This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated and skilled Veterinary Surgeon to become part of a collaborative, forward-thinking team, working in a busy, well-resourced hospital that prides itself on clinical excellence.

If you are interested in this role, please contact Dan ASAP: 01395 200189 / Daniel.Howe@SynergyVets.com

The team strongly values work-life balance—appointments finish by 6:45pm, with the clinic closing at 7pm. Additional protected time is allocated after closing for administrative tasks, and the daily schedule includes a 1-hour lunch break and designated time for phone calls.

The practice fosters a supportive and inclusive atmosphere where staff wellbeing is a priority. Sociable dogs are welcome at work and in the staff areas, and the site includes an enclosed car park for quick breaks, with a park nearby for lunchtime walks.

The team is seeking a veterinary surgeon with strong small animal general practice experience, a positive attitude, and a collaborative mindset. A good sense of humour and a commitment to professional growth are also highly valued.

• Must have right to work in the UK.

The role involves managing and organising the hospital, fostering a positive and collaborative work environment, and working in partnership with other key members of the management team to deliver a professional service to clients, patients, and referring veterinarians.

The individual will provide leadership and support to the clinical team, promoting high standards of patient care and prioritising team wellbeing. They will be accountable for the quality of clinical operations within the hospital, including scheduling, resource allocation, and maintaining efficient workflows, while adhering to budgetary guidelines and ensuring outstanding communication and service to referring veterinarians and clients.

They will ensure compliance with the RCVS Guide to Professional Conduct and other relevant professional requirements, including maintaining registration, memberships, and reporting obligations.

Support will be provided to the wider hospital team in meeting the ethical responsibilities associated with a veterinary referral environment, ensuring both clinical and support staff fulfil these duties.

This role requires an exceptional individual capable of working under pressure with flexibility. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are essential, along with a proven track record in leading large teams, preferably within a veterinary or clinical setting.

The role also demands a commitment to safe, efficient decision-making, expert clinical care, and compassionate communication. The successful candidate will be care-driven, highly organised, and able to support a dynamic 24/7 team environment.

Other

description:

The ideal candidate will have over 3 years of experience, including at least one year practicing within the UK. A genuine passion for early diagnostics, strong follow-through on treatment plans, and a commitment to ongoing clinical development are essential.

The successful Veterinary Surgeon will be responsible for delivering preventive care, diagnosing and treating a wide range of conditions, and managing cases with care, consistency, and attention to patient wellbeing. Clear communication and a collaborative approach are key, as they’ll be working closely alongside both clinical and non-clinical colleagues as part of a close-knit team.

The role is as follows:
**Full-time Vets typically work a 4-day week
**39 hours per week with 9-hour shifts
**Mix of consulting and surgical duties
**Dedicated daily admin hour included within the rota
**Weekend rota: 1-in-4

My client understands that flexibility matters. If you’re looking for a slightly different working pattern, they’re more than happy to discuss options to support work-life balance.


There is a comprehensive benefits package, including:
**Quarterly recognition payments
**Enhanced maternity & paternity pay
**Income protection
**Electric car scheme
**Boost employee benefits and discounts
**Health and wellbeing support via Help at Hand
**Funded professional memberships
**Surgery discounts
**CPD allowance
**25 days holiday plus bank holidays
**Internal leadership training opportunities

The successful candidate will be joining a modern, purpose-built veterinary practice equipped with fantastic facilities designed to deliver the highest standard of care. The team is skilled, supportive, and passionate about clinical excellence, with many colleagues currently working towards or holding advanced certificates.

Could you be the newest member of this forward-thinking team?

Get in touch with Lacey now for more details: 01395 200189 / lacey.dorliac@synergyvets.com

title: Full-time Veterinary Surgeon role at West Yorkshire PDSA
description:
We work closely with the PDSA, a charity providing veterinary care across the UK, who are seeking a Vet to join them permanently on a full-time basis!

• Veterinary Surgeon
• Salary £43,950-£58,312 (including allowances) per annum
• Full-time, permanent.
• 37.5 hours per week
• Flexible working options available regarding hours and shifts!

Would you like to work somewhere that delivers veterinary services which truly make a difference in peoples lives? Then this might be the perfect role for you.

With a focus on clinical impact rather than performance targets, PDSA combines pragmatic veterinary care with a strong emphasis on client service and compassion.

PDSA is seeking qualified Veterinary Surgeons who are prepared to take on a diverse and dynamic caseload. Candidates must demonstrate confidence in communicating effectively with both clients and colleagues. A collaborative mindset and a willingness to mentor and lead by example are essential.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about the charity’s mission, supportive of client contribution initiatives, and mindful of resource efficiency. The role is fast-paced and rewarding, and the organisation supports work-life balance with various flexible working arrangements available.

Their Pet Hospital in West Yorkshire offers a modern, well-equipped facility with separate dog and cat wards, in-house radiography, ultrasound, endoscopy, piped gases, and extensive orthopaedic equipment. The team consists of professionals with varied clinical interests, fostering a collaborative and supportive environment for discussing cases and treatment plans.

Flexible weekend rotas and any required out-of-hours work are supported with enhanced pay and compensatory time off during the week.

PDSA is committed to being a great place to work, where employees feel valued and empowered to make a meaningful difference. This commitment has led to the organisation being ranked among the UK’s top 25 large employers.

Employees benefit from a wide range of perks, including:
• Remote and flexible working options
• CPD allowance of one week and £1,000 per year
• Full payment of RCVS fees
• Access to internal CPD programmes and discounts for BSAVA Congress and London Vet Show
• 25 days of annual leave (excluding bank holidays) with the option to buy or sell up to 5 days
• An additional Wellbeing Day for personal recharge
• Generous pension schemes (auto-enrolment starting at 5% contribution, up to 10%)
• Life Assurance policy (4x annual salary)
• 24/7 Employee Assistance Program and Online Wellbeing Centre
• Retail, holiday, and lifestyle discounts!

To apply for this fantastic charitable role, please contact Dan now on: 01395 200189 / Daniel.Howe@SynergyVets.com

title: Bank Registered Veterinary Nurse role at Merseyside PDSA
description:

This is a rewarding opportunity at PDSA, a respected organisation delivering expert veterinary care to pet owners who may otherwise be unable to access treatment. The vital work carried out by PDSA makes a meaningful difference to both people and their pets.

PDSA is currently seeking qualified Registered Veterinary Nurses (RVNs) to join their Bank team, providing flexible, ad hoc shift cover. The position offers a varied workload, including a mix of consulting and hands-on clinical work, giving nurses the opportunity to broaden their experience.

PDSA hospitals are staffed by dedicated teams with a wide range of clinical interests, encouraging collaborative working and shared learning.

Each hospital is equipped with modern facilities, including separate dog and cat wards, in-house radiography, ultrasound, endoscopy, piped gases, and a full range of orthopaedic equipment. The team structure also supports flexibility around weekends and out-of-hours shifts, which are compensated with enhanced pay and time off during the week.

If you are interested in this role, please contact Emillie ASAP on: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

title: Vet Surgeon Role in West Yorkshire – Weekends & Occasional Weekday Cover
description:
We work closely with the PDSA and their Pet Hospitals in West Yorkshire are seeking a qualified Vet Surgeon to work part time during the week at one branch and part time on weekends at another branch.

• Salary £43, 950 – £58,312 per annum (pro rata), plus additional uplift for weekend hours.
• Part-time/flexible working considered
• Based in two West Yorkshire Pet Hospitals (30 mins apart)

PDSA is a unique organisation providing expert veterinary care to people across the UK who would otherwise be unable to afford treatment for their pets. The work carried out at PDSA has a meaningful impact on both pets and their owners.

The organisation’s approach blends pragmatism with a strong focus on client care, aiming to deliver effective clinical outcomes without being driven by targets. PDSA measures its success through impact, not numbers.

PDSA is currently seeking a passionate Veterinary Surgeon who values flexibility and purpose-driven work to join its team.

Weekend Cover
The successful candidate will join the emergency clinic team for daytime weekend shifts. This position is well-suited to a vet who thrives in a fast-paced, well-supported environment, delivering essential and urgent care.

At this hospital, you will collaborate with another experienced vet to provide excellent clinical care in an emergency-only setting. The team includes skilled veterinary nurses, receptionists, and management staff, all committed to fostering a collaborative and supportive atmosphere.

Shift Structure:
• One vet: 9:00am – 6:00pm
• Second vet: 10:30am – 6:00pm

This dual-coverage model ensures shared caseloads and robust clinical collaboration. The role offers opportunities for professional development in emergency medicine and welcomes discussions about flexibility, including the number of weekends worked per month and whether the candidate prefers Saturdays, Sundays, or both.

Weekday Cover
During the week, you will work a healthy work-life balance while still practicing high-quality veterinary medicine.

Typical weekday hours are from 8:30am to 5:00pm, but PDSA is open to discussions around working days and hours to accommodate individual preferences.

PDSA’s veterinary teams possess a wide range of clinical interests, creating a rich pool of knowledge and experience for collaborative case discussion and treatment planning.

Both Hospitals are modern and well-equipped, featuring:
• Separate dog and cat kennelling facilities
• In-house radiography, ultrasound, and endoscopy
• Piped gases
• Extensive orthopaedic equipment

The hospital teams are large enough to support flexible rotas and provide enhanced pay and compensatory time off when weekend shifts are worked.

Benefits included in this role include:
• CPD allowance of £1,000 and one week per year
• Full payment of RCVS fees
• Access to internal CPD programmes, with discounts for BSAVA Congress and London Vet Show
• 25 days holiday (excluding Bank Holidays), with the option to buy or sell up to 5 days annually
• One additional Wellbeing Day per year
• Generous pension options: Auto-Enrolment and Contributory schemes starting at 5%, up to 10%
• Life Assurance (4x annual salary)
• 24/7 Employee Assistance Programme and Online Wellbeing Centre
• Discounts on retail, holidays, and more!

If you are interested, please contact Dan ASAP on: 01395 200189 / Daniel.Howe@SynergyVets.com

This well-established and busy small animal practice is supported by a long-standing team known for their friendly atmosphere and strong team spirit.

The current team includes 6 Veterinary Surgeons, 8 Registered Veterinary Nurses, a Student Veterinary Nurse, a Veterinary Care Assistant, 7 Receptionists, and a Practice Manager. Under experienced leadership, the team has grown significantly over the years, creating a collaborative and supportive environment dedicated to providing excellent pet healthcare.

Conveniently located with easy access to major transport links including the M6 and M69, the practice benefits from a varied caseload thanks to its position within a busy retail setting in a popular residential area. This provides a steady flow of diverse and interesting medical and surgical cases.

The purpose-built, air-conditioned surgery is bright and spacious, equipped to industry-leading standards with digital radiography, ultrasound, and in-house laboratory equipment, enabling the team to deliver high-quality clinical care.

The role would suit a lead or experienced Veterinary Surgeon who is confident in routine surgical and medical procedures. Special interests are welcomed and supported, and while experience with exotics is desirable, it is not essential. The practice handles a wide variety of clinical cases and offers opportunities for professional development in specialised areas.

Benefits include:
• 5.6 weeks annual leave (including bank holidays), increasing with service
• Extra day off on your birthday
• Supported and funded CPD and certificates
• Paid professional memberships (RCVS, BVA, VDS)
• Contributory pension scheme

To apply, please contact Emillie now on: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

Complex cases are seen regularly, providing excellent opportunities for clinical growth. The two branches are integral parts of their local communities and offer a range of general practice services. The team is committed to delivering the highest standard of care for every patient and developing strong client relationships.

Situated in a picturesque market town nestled in the Surrey Hills, the area offers access to beautiful countryside, historic landmarks, and attractions such as local breweries. London is just over an hour away, providing convenient access to the capital and its transport links.
