title: Veterinary Nurse Vacancies at RSPCA West Midlands Animal Hospital
description:
The RSPCA is seeking two qualified and registered Veterinary Nurses to join the Veterinary Team at its Animal Hospital in the West Midlands.

• Salary: £27,928 - £30,160 (inclusive of 4% shift allowance)
• Permanent, 35 hours per week, based on a 10-week rolling rota.
• Day shifts: 8:00am – 3:30pm
• Evening shifts: 2:30pm – 10:00pm
• Night shifts: 10:00pm – 8:00am (one week in every ten, with a 33% night shift allowance)

Reporting to a Nursing Team Leader, the successful candidates will contribute to a dedicated team of seven Veterinary Surgeons, 20 RVNs, and nine support staff.

Night shifts primarily involve caring for non-critical inpatients. The hospital, situated in a rural 70-acre countryside setting just 20 minutes from central Birmingham, offers excellent motorway access and modern, spacious facilities.

Veterinary Nurses at the hospital play a crucial role in supporting animal welfare, particularly through cases referred by RSPCA Inspectors and affiliated centres. Duties span across medical and surgical care for a wide range of patients, including cats, dogs, and wildlife.

Key Responsibilities:
• Support welfare and case work
• Deliver direct patient care
• Maintain accurate clinical records
• Dispense medications per guidelines
• Uphold hygiene and biosecurity standards
• Monitor anaesthesia and assist in theatre procedures
• Participate in community outreach initiatives
• Engage in continuous professional development

Requirements:
• RCVS-registered Veterinary Nurse qualification
• Relevant experience in clinical or welfare settings (veterinary practices, wildlife centres, etc.)
• Strong communication and teamwork abilities
• Clinical decision-making and prioritization skills
• Initiative and autonomy in professional practice

Additional Information:
• A DBS check may be required for successful applicants
• Candidates must have the legal right to work in the UK (visa sponsorship is not available)

The organization welcomes applications from individuals of all backgrounds!

If you are interested, please contact Emillie now on: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

description:
Emillie is working with a well-established practice in Cheshire who are looking for an Advanced Practitioner in Dermatology to join their friendly and enthusiastic team of referral Vets. Working alongside dedicated Night Vets and experienced RVNs.

• Salary starting at £55,000 per annum (DOE).
• Ideally Full-time, usually full days 8.45am – 6.45pm
• Open to discussion regarding part-time hours for the right applicant.

The practice is part of a long-established Veterinary Group, and is a small animal, first opinion, referral and emergency practice. They are committed to achieving the highest standards in both patient and client care and are looking for a colleague to contribute to and share these aims.

They are in need of an Advanced Practitioner in Dermatology to join their team of referral vets with dedicated night vets and experienced RVNs. They have a busy and varied dermatology case load, so you will need to be able to manage referral dermatology cases independently. You will be working in their advanced practitioner led multi-disciplinary hospital to provide the highest quality care to patients and referring vets. They have a CT on site, video otoscopy, blue light therapy plus a dedicated microscope and consulting room specifically for dermatology.
You will work closely with their referral teams, particularly soft tissue surgery and medicine and have the support of their referral’s coordinator.

The practice is a modern and well-equipped premises, including a veterinary hospital with laboratory, highly equipped operating theatres, endoscopy, 24/7 hospitalisation and more.
You must be enthusiastic, with good communication skills and the ability to work closely with a multidisciplinary team.

An excellent range of benefits include:

description:
The PDSA Hospital in Staffordshire is seeking a qualified Vet Surgeon, who is up for a challenge, to join them on a part-time basis!

• Hours: 15 hours per week
• Contract: Part Time, Permanent
• Flexible working options are available regarding hours and shifts.

The PDSA is a unique organisation providing expert veterinary care to people across the UK who otherwise would not be able to afford treatment for their pets. The charity’s work has a meaningful impact, focusing on delivering excellent clinical outcomes rather than simply meeting targets. Pragmatism is combined with a strong client care ethos, ensuring that every decision benefits both pets and their owners.

You must be ready for a challenge and able to adapt to the wide range of cases seen within the charity. Successful candidates will be confident communicators, able to engage with a variety of colleagues and clients, and willing to share expertise while leading by example.
The ideal candidate will be passionate about championing PDSA’s mission, promoting client contributions, and seeking efficiencies to make the best use of resources. The role is fast-paced and varied, so maintaining a healthy work-life balance is a priority. Flexible working arrangements are available to support this.

The hospitals veterinary teams have a broad range of clinical interests, offering access to a wealth of shared knowledge and experience for discussing cases and treatment plans.
All are modern and well-equipped, featuring separate dog and cat kennels, in-house radiography, ultrasound, endoscopy, piped gases, and a wide range of orthopaedic equipment. Team size allows for flexibility in weekend rotas and any out-of-hours commitments, with enhanced pay and stand-down time during the week when weekend work is undertaken.

Further benefits include:
• Remote and flexible working options
• CPD Allowance of one week and £1,000 per year
• Full RCVS fees covered
• Range of internal CPD programmes plus discounts for BSAVA Congress and London Vet Show
• 25 days holiday (excluding Bank Holidays) with the option to buy or sell up to 5 days per year
• An additional Wellbeing Day for personal recharge
• Generous Auto-Enrolment pension and/or Contributory pension schemes (starting at 5% contributions, rising to 10%)
• Life Assurance policy (4 x annual salary)
• 24/7 Employee Assistance Programme and Online Wellbeing Centre for confidential support
• Wide range of retail, holiday, and leisure discounts!

If you are interested in working with this fantastic Charity, please contact Emillie now on: 01395 2000189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

description:
My client is seeking a dedicated Veterinary Surgeon to join their friendly and supportive team in Cardiff on a 12-month maternity cover contract. This is a full-time role offering a salary of up to £50,000 depending on experience, with a strong emphasis on fostering a Just Culture and creating a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected and supported.

They operate across three small animal branches in the Cardiff area, with a shared rota that includes consulting, surgical and inpatient responsibilities. While a local out-of-hours provider handles emergency calls overnight, inpatients remain on site with nursing care to ensure continuity and reduce unnecessary movement for unwell animals.

As a modern, well-equipped first-opinion practice, everything you’d expect to deliver excellent clinical care is available.

This full-time position is based on a four-day working week (40 hours), with a 1-in-5 Saturday rota, no out-of-hours commitment and no Bank Holiday working. Consultations are set at 20 minutes as standard, and protected admin time is built into the working day. You’ll enjoy genuine clinical freedom with support always available when needed, and a balanced mix of consulting, operating and inpatient work across the week.

The team you’ll be joining is large, welcoming and wellbeing-focused, with around 20 vets and 19 nurses including multiple certificate holders.

The practice takes pride in prioritising colleague support, development and wellbeing. Career satisfaction and progression truly matter here.

The role comes with an excellent benefits package, including up to £50,000 salary depending on experience, 6.6 weeks paid holiday including Bank Holidays, £1,750 CPD allowance, paid RCVS membership plus two other professional subscriptions, VDS cover, enhanced family-related leave, discounted veterinary fees and a wide range of wellbeing and lifestyle perks. Additional benefits include sick pay, funded training, colleague engagement initiatives, annual pay reviews, cycle-to-work scheme and clear opportunities for career progression.

If you’re looking to work with a team that genuinely values its people, encourages professional growth and champions a positive, supportive culture, look no further!

In this role, you will oversee the full clinical and operational running of the practice. Your work will ensure the highest standards of patient care, smooth day-to-day workflow, excellent client experience, and responsible use of resources as a charity. You’ll also take responsibility for budgeting treatment costs, monitoring income and expenditure, and ensuring the practice remains sustainable without compromising on care.

They’re looking for someone who leads by example, communicates with warmth and clarity, and enjoys bringing out the best in others. You should be confident making clinical and operational decisions, adaptable when challenges arise, and committed to compassionate, high-quality veterinary care. A strong background in clinical work and people management is essential.

In return, they're offering a generous package including a salary of £65,563–£71,616 (DOE), flexible working options, 38 hours of funded CPD and a £1,000 annual CPD allowance, full RCVS fees paid, strong leadership and career development pathways, and access to a wide range of internal training programmes. You’ll receive 25 days’ holiday plus bank holidays, with the option to buy or sell up to five days, along with an additional Wellbeing Day, Celebration Day and Volunteering Day each year. They also provide enhanced pension contributions of 5–10%, life assurance at four times your salary, private medical insurance, 24/7 wellbeing support, Cycle to Work, free flu vaccination and a wide selection of retail and leisure discounts.

If you’re a motivated and empathetic Veterinary Surgeon who thrives in a fast-paced, purpose-driven environment, this is an opportunity to make a real impact. Get in touch for more details!

title: Veterinary Surgeon job – Berkshire (Multi-Site Role)
description:
Location: Based in Berkshire with additional branch coverage
Contract: Permanent, 4 days per week
Hours: Rota-based (details below)

About the Role:

My client are seeking an enthusiastic and committed Veterinary Surgeon to join their friendly and supportive small animal practice in Berkshire. You will work across the main hospital site and local branch surgeries, delivering high-quality medical and surgical care in line with RCVS standards.

This role offers a varied caseload, opportunities to develop your clinical interests, and the chance to work within a collaborative team that values professionalism, excellent client care and strong communication.

Key Responsibilities

• Consult, diagnose, and medically treat small animals
• Perform a range of surgical procedures including neutering and general surgery
• Participate in the emergency and out-of-hours rota (no overnight on-call)

• Demonstrate consistent professional standards in attendance, punctuality and presentation
• Adhere to health & safety policies and practice protocols
• Promote relevant services such as nurse clinics, preventative care, and special offers
• Provide guidance, support and supervision to nursing and support staff
• Maintain commercial awareness—provide clear estimates and manage client expectations
• Build strong relationships with clients, colleagues and the wider community

• Undertake CPD in line with RCVS guidelines
• Complete additional duties at the request of the Practice Principal or Practice Manager

Working Hours & Rota

• Start time: 8:30am (or 8:00am on operating days)
• Finish time: between 5:30pm and 6:30pm, depending on rota
• No overnight on-call
• Once per week: on-call until 9pm (1pm start on these days)
• 4 days per week, with one full day off each week (unless following a duty weekend)
• 1 full weekend in 5, including Saturday & Sunday morning consults and on-call until 5pm
• Monday and Friday off in the week following a duty weekend

Essential Skills & Experience

• MRCVS-registered Veterinary Surgeon
• Post-qualification experience in small animal practice
• Occasional large animal experience beneficial
• Strong verbal and written communication skills
• Good IT literacy
• Excellent organisational and time-management abilities
• Client-focused with strong customer care skills
• Able to remain calm under pressure
• Self-motivated, confident working independently
• Positive, enthusiastic and a strong team player
• Full driving licence (own car required; must be insured for business use)
• Must live within an agreed commuting distance of the practice

Benefits:

• Salary DOE
• Contributory pension scheme
• Private healthcare
• RCVS and BSAVA memberships paid
• VDS cover included
• Funded CPD, including additional time off as required
• 27 days annual leave plus bank holidays (or TOIL for bank holidays worked)
• Heavily discounted staff pet scheme
• Free onsite parking

title: Well-established small animal branch in Lancashire seeks Vet
description:
My client is looking for a dedicated Small Animal Veterinary Surgeon to join their friendly and well-established team in Lancashire. This role is available on a full or part-time basis, with a salary of £40,000–£65,000 pro rata depending on experience. If you’re looking for a position where you’ll feel genuinely supported, have room to grow and enjoy a great mix of clinical work, this could be the perfect next step.

The practice has been part of the local community for many years and is proud to offer high-quality first-opinion veterinary care across multiple sites in the area. Their small animal team sees a varied and interesting caseload, making the role ideal for an experienced vet who enjoys developing their skills, especially if you have an interest in surgery or orthopaedics.

The team is warm, welcoming and very supportive. They put a lot of effort into making sure colleagues feel appreciated, with regular wellbeing check-ins and a focus on creating a happy, positive working environment. The team also enjoys getting involved in local events and charity activities, from community days to sponsored walks and fun runs.

The full-time rota is 40 hours a week, with 1 in 8 weekends on call and one weeknight on call every two weeks. My client knows how demanding on-call work can be, so the rota ensures you receive the following day off after each on-call shift, plus generous time off in lieu for weekend work. There is also on-site accommodation available for anyone who prefers to stay over when on call. Part-time and flexible options are also available.

Overnight care is strongly supported by a team of dedicated night RVNs, including ECC certificate holders, which makes providing out-of-hours cover far more manageable and ensures excellent care for inpatients. An answering service takes night calls, so you won’t be handling the phone directly.

The practice is very well equipped, with digital x-ray, ultrasound, flexible and rigid endoscopy, two theatres with multiparameter monitoring, a dental suite with dental x-ray, an extensive in-house lab and separate dog and cat wards. They work closely with visiting specialists in ultrasonography and cardiology, meaning most cases can be worked up in-house.

The team includes vets and nurses with a wide range of certificates and special interests, so you’ll be surrounded by people who love sharing knowledge and supporting each other's development. As a training practice for both vet and nurse students, learning and progression are part of everyday life.

The benefits package is strong and includes 6.6 weeks’ holiday including Bank Holidays, a holiday buy-back scheme, paid volunteering leave, an Employee Assistance Programme, discounted gym membership, Cycle to Work scheme, enhanced family leave, private medical insurance options and generous CPD support with five paid CPD days (pro rata). Professional fees (RCVS, VDS and two more memberships) are covered, and colleagues’ pets receive treatment at cost.

If you’re looking to join a genuinely supportive team in Lancashire, where you can develop your interests, enjoy a varied caseload and feel valued at work, then get in touch!

Overall, this position will suit a dedicated and communicative veterinary surgeon who values teamwork, ongoing development, and the continuity of care made possible by an in-house emergency service. If you're looking for an independent, supportive, and clinically engaging environment in South Wales, then get in touch ASAP!

title: Full Time Veterinary Surgeon job – East London
description:
Laceys client has an excellent opportunity for a dedicated, customer-focused Veterinary Surgeon to join a modern, purpose-built practice in East London.

Salary: £50,000–£70,000 DOE
Hours: Full Time, 39 hours per week + 1:4 weekends


They’re ideally seeking a Vet with 3+ years’ experience, including at least one year practicing in the UK. You’ll have a genuine passion for early diagnostics, a strong commitment to delivering and following through on treatment plans, and a real interest in continuous clinical development.

You’ll be responsible for providing preventive care, diagnosing and treating a wide range of conditions, and managing cases with compassion and consistency. Clear communication skills and the ability to collaborate as part of a close-knit, supportive team are essential. You’ll be working alongside clinical and non-clinical colleagues who share a strong focus on pet wellbeing.

Working Hours & Flexibility:
Full-time Vets generally work a 4-day week, with a consistent day off to support a healthy work-life balance. Shifts are 9 hours and include a mix of consulting and surgery across the week. Each Vet has a dedicated hour built into the working day for admin and clinical follow-up.

Weekend rota: 1-in-4.

Flexible working options are available, and alternative working patterns can be discussed. Laceys client is committed to finding an arrangement that works for you.


To attract and retain the best talent, our client offers a strong benefits package, including:
• Quarterly recognition payments
• Enhanced maternity and paternity pay
• Income protection
• Electric car scheme
• Employee benefits platform and retail discounts
• Health and wellbeing support
• Funded memberships
• Surgery discounts
• CPD allowance
• 25 days’ holiday plus bank holidays
• Internal leadership training


You’ll be working in a purpose-built, modern practice with excellent facilities and a team passionate about delivering the highest standards of veterinary care. The team has a wide range of clinical interests and many are working towards or have achieved certificates to further enhance the services offered.

This practice is part of the UK’s largest independent, family-owned veterinary group, with a nationwide presence. They provide exceptional care to local communities, helping pets live long, healthy lives. Their surgeries are designed to be light, spacious and equipped with the latest technology, creating a calm environment for patients and a great place to work for colleagues.

If you’re looking to join a supportive team and have an interest in this permanent Small Animal Vet job in East London, get in touch with Lacey today on the contact details above

description:

This independent, family-run practice is proud of its close-knit team and commitment to delivering the highest standards of veterinary care. The modern, spacious facilities are fully equipped with state-of-the-art equipment and designed to provide a supportive and collaborative working environment.

The practice team includes multiple vets, a dedicated nursing team, experienced reception staff, and supportive practice managers (some with over 20 years in practice). The successful candidate will take on a pivotal leadership role, working closely with the management team to deliver outstanding veterinary care, mentor junior vets, and help drive the practice forward. Experience in handling more complex cases would be beneficial, as well as the ability to provide guidance to less experienced colleagues.

Further benefits include:
• Funded CPD, including support for management and clinical qualifications
• Professional registration fees fully covered
• Partnership potential for the right individual

Veterinary professionals interested in shaping the future of this well-established Staffordshire practice are encouraged to get in touch to discuss this exciting opportunity further.

description:

The successful candidate will be an experienced Veterinary Surgeon (3+ years) with either a certificate in ophthalmology or the ambition to pursue one. As a key member of the clinical team, they will be responsible for preventive services, diagnosing and treating sick or injured pets, and promoting overall pet wellbeing. Strong communication skills, teamwork, and a genuine passion for animal care are essential.

The practice is purpose-built and spacious, equipped with excellent facilities and supported by a passionate and skilled team. Colleagues bring a broad range of expertise, with many working towards certificates to enhance clinical services. Continuous professional development is strongly encouraged, with initiatives in place to support skill growth at every level within the surgery.

title: Well-established Devon Practice seeks Ambitious Vet Surgeon
description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for an ambitious veterinary surgeon to join a friendly, well-established and busy practice in Devon.

• Salary up to £60,000 depending on experience
• Ideally a minimum of 30 hours per week
• Including 1 in 3 Saturdays
• No OOHs!
• Flexibility available regarding hours (Full or Part-time options).

The practice is led by an experienced Clinical Lead Vet, who is working towards a certificate in Emergency and Critical Care, alongside a dedicated Head Nurse and Clinical Coach. They are supported by a fantastic team, all committed to delivering an outstanding level of care to the local community. The practice offers a spacious environment with modern facilities, state-of-the-art equipment, and plenty of onsite parking.

This role would suit a confident vet with a broad range of GP skills, comfortable with sole charge, and with strong communication and teamwork abilities. The successful candidate will be both a people person and an animal person, joining a welcoming and supportive team dedicated to delivering excellent veterinary care.

The caseload is varied, ranging from routine health consults to more complex medical cases and surgeries, with opportunities to further develop knowledge and skills. Days are busy but well-structured, with 15-minute consults as standard and time for admin, breaks, and lunch built into the schedule.

Flexible hours are available, with full or part-time options depending on individual needs. The role ideally covers a minimum of 30 hours per week, preferably including 1 in 3 Saturdays, with no OOH commitments. However, flexibility is key, and the team is open to discussion with the right candidate.

Further Benefits include:
• 28 days paid holiday, rising to 33 after 2 years of service
• Excellent career development opportunities
• Contributory pension scheme
• Contributory private healthcare
• Life assurance (4x annual salary)
• Generous CPD allowance, including funding towards certificates
• Paid memberships (RCVS, VDS, etc.)
• Cycle to work scheme
• Exclusive discounts and rewards!

A relocation package, including support with accommodation costs, is available for the right candidate. This role offers the chance to build a rewarding career in Devon, a county known for its vibrant culture, historic attractions, stunning coastline, and easy access to some of the UK’s most beautiful beaches and national parks.

If you are interested in this fantastic role, please contact Lacey now on: 01395 200189 / Lacey.Dorliac@SynergyVets.com

title: Exciting Vet Surgeon Vacancies at SW London practice
description:
Laceys client has 2 fantastic Veterinary opportunities for dedicated, customer-focused Veterinary Surgeons to join their team in SW London.

They're looking for 2 passionate, knowledgeable Veterinary Surgeons ideally with over 3 years’ experience, to become key members of their surgery’s team, delivering excellence in clinical care and customer service:

• 1 GP Vet
• 1 Vet with Advanced Surgery Orthopaedic Experience

You’ll be responsible for delivering preventive services, treating sick and injured pets and be able to demonstrate a real passion for promoting pet wellbeing. You'll be an excellent communicator and a real team player, integrating well with our wider clinical and non-clinical team members.

Both roles are full time, working 37 hours per week on a shared rota or early and late shifts
You must also be able to commit to a 1:4 weekend rota

Everyone receives a warm welcome from the team, and they are all passionate about providing the very best care to every pet that comes through the doors, day and night.

To ensure the care they're offering is the absolute best, they’re constantly working on new initiatives to support skill gaps and we make sure CPD is continuous and happening across all levels in the surgery.

Clinical team members have either achieved or are working towards various certificates, including emergency & critical care and small animal surgery, and another Vet with a keen interest in Dentistry. All are well-supported by our Customer Experience Manager and team of Customer Experience Coordinators.

They’re continually investing in developing their growing team and there's never been a better time to join the UK’s largest, independent, family-owned veterinary group with a nationwide presence, who offer exceptional care in the local communities, helping pets live long, happy and healthy lives with their families. State-of-the-art surgeries are purpose-built, light and spacious and equipped with the latest technology.

They’re committed to creating an environment that offers exceptional clinical care and where colleagues love to work, patients are calm and customers feel assured.

title: Part-time Vet Surgeon role in West Sussex
description:
A respected, independent veterinary practice in West Sussex is seeking a dedicated and experienced Veterinary Surgeon to join the team on a part-time basis, working two or three days per week. This role is based across a modern, well-equipped hospital and a busy, thriving branch clinic.

• Salary - up to £65,000+ (full time equivalent) DOE/certificates/AP status
• Ideally 3 days per week: Mondays, Tuesdays & Fridays
• Standard 10-hour shifts
• Hours between 7:30am-7:30pm (with 1hr lunch break)
• Would consider 2 days (Tues & Fri)

The team is passionate about delivering exceptional care and building strong, trusting relationships with clients. The working environment is warm and welcoming, designed to provide both patients and staff with a calm, homely atmosphere. Collaboration is key, with in-house night cover and an Advanced Practitioner referral service enabling seamless, personalised care 24/7.

This is a first-opinion GP role with a flexible structure. Consult-only vets will be considered. Ideally, the role would be spread over three days per week (Monday, Tuesday, and Friday), but a two-day arrangement (Tuesday and Friday) could be available for the right candidate. Standard shifts are 10 hours with a 1-hour lunch break, typically between 7:30am and 7:30pm. There is flexibility around shift patterns, provided fairness across the team is maintained.
All vets contribute to weekend, bank holiday, and on-call rotas, with exact arrangements to be discussed at interview.

Candidate Requirements:
• MRCVS-qualified Veterinary Surgeon
• Minimum 3 years of small animal practice experience (at least 1 year in the UK)
• Strong alignment with core values: humility, respect, empathy, work ethic, honesty, communication, and teamwork

Further benefits from this role include:
• Generously funded CPD (£1,500 annually or £2,000 for Advanced Practitioners, plus 5 days leave in lieu)
• Certificate funding available
• 7 weeks holiday (including bank holidays)
• 40% staff discount for own pets
• Standard pension contributions
• Occupational health support including mental health resources
• Enhanced parental leave after qualifying period (6 months paid at 90%)
• Enhanced sickness benefit (2 weeks at 100%)

This is an opportunity to be part of a progressive, supportive, and genuinely valued-driven practice that prioritises clinical freedom, kindness, and professional growth.

If this sounds like the job for you, please contact Lacey now on: 01395 200189 / Lacey.Dorliac@SynergyVets.com

title: Full-time Veterinary Nurse Vacancy – PDSA West Midlands
description:
We work closely with the PDSA and their Hospital in the West Midlands is seeking a Registered Vet Nurse to join them full-time!

• Salary between £26,655 - £31,027 per annum
• Hours: 37.5 per week
• Full-time, temporary contract
• Flexible working options available regarding hours and shifts!

The PDSA is a unique organisation providing expert veterinary care to people across the UK who would otherwise be unable to afford treatment for their pets. The charity focuses on impact rather than targets, combining pragmatism with strong client care to deliver positive clinical outcomes.

Employee wellbeing is a priority at PDSA, with a supportive and engaging environment that provides access to expert advice, resources, and professional development opportunities to help every team member succeed.

Their Pet Hospital is seeking a qualified Registered Veterinary Nurse who is adaptable, proactive, and ready for the challenges of a varied caseload. The successful candidate will play a key role in consultations, in-patient care, dispensing medications, and assisting in theatre, including schedule 3 surgery.

Strong communication skills with both colleagues and clients are essential, along with a willingness to share knowledge and lead by example. The nurse will also be encouraged to champion the charity, promote client contributions, and contribute to resource efficiency.

The role is fast-paced and rewarding, with flexible working options available to support a healthy work-life balance.

The Hospital is modern, well-equipped, and designed to provide high-quality care. Facilities typically include separate dog and cat kennels, in-house radiography, ultrasound, endoscopy, piped gases, and extensive orthopaedic equipment.

The team is made up of veterinary professionals with varied clinical interests, ensuring a wealth of shared knowledge and experience when discussing cases and treatment plans. The hospital also offers a flexible approach to weekend rotas and out-of-hours requirements, with enhanced pay and stand-down time during the week when weekends are worked.

Further benefits include:
• Flexible and remote working options
• CPD allowance of one week and £500 per year
• Full RCVS fees paid
• Internal CPD programmes and discounts for BSAVA Congress and London Vet Show
• 25 days holiday (excluding Bank Holidays), with the option to buy or sell up to 5 days
• An additional Wellbeing Day for rest and recharge
• Generous Auto-Enrolment and Contributory pension schemes (5–10% contributions)
• Life Assurance policy (4x annual salary)
• 24/7 Employee Assistance Programme and Online Wellbeing Centre
• Discounts on retail, holidays, and more!

If you are interested in contributing to this fantastic charity, please contact Emillie now on: 01395 200189 / Emillie.Loaring@SynergyVets.com

title: Part-time Vet Nurse role at PDSA in West Midlands

• Salary £26,655 - £31,027 per annum pro rata
• 15 hours per week

The PDSA is a unique organisation providing expert veterinary care to people across the UK who may otherwise be unable to afford treatment for their pets. The work carried out by PDSA truly makes a difference.
The organisation combines pragmatism with a strong client-care focus to deliver excellent clinical outcomes, measuring success by impact rather than targets.
Staff wellbeing is a priority, and PDSA offers a supportive and engaging working environment. Team members have access to expert advice and resources to help them succeed in their roles.

The successful candidate will demonstrate confidence in communicating with a wide range of colleagues and clients, sharing skills, and leading by example. A passion for the charity’s mission, promoting client contributions, and suggesting efficiencies will be valued highly.
As the role can be fast-paced and challenging, PDSA is committed to supporting a work-life balance that meets both personal and organisational needs. Flexible working options are available.

The PDSA Hospitals are modern and well-equipped, typically featuring separate dog and cat kennelling facilities, in-house radiography, ultrasound, endoscopy, piped gases, and extensive orthopaedic equipment.
Veterinary teams consist of members with varied clinical interests, providing a wide pool of knowledge and experience for case discussions and treatment planning. The size of the team also allows for a flexible approach to weekend rotas and any out-of-hours requirements, with enhanced pay and stand-down time during the week following weekend shifts.

In addition to a supportive workplace, the organisation offers a wide range of benefits, including:
• Remote and flexible working options
